label: 魚々子
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 57th  . Nara National Museum . 2005
説明文: A decorative ground texture for metal pieces, it consists of small round grains, appearing like scattered fish eggs, from which it derives its name.In Tang China, nanako decorations were common on gold and silver pieces, and on mirrors. Examples in Japan date from as early as the Asuka period.
